Paragraph: Treatment of WT mice with topical ocular 0 . 1 % dexamethasone led to elevation of intraocular pressure ( IOP ) , functional and structural loss of retinal ganglion cells , and axonal degeneration , resembling glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma in human patients .

2. Intraocular pressure (IOP): While not a chemical itself, IOP is a measurement of pressure inside the eye, which can be influenced by various factors, including certain chemicals or medications.
3. Glucocorticoid: This is a class of corticosteroids that are used to suppress the immune system and reduce inflammation. Dexamethasone is a type of glucocorticoid.
